item.text: Then Solomon convened in Jerusalem Israel’s elders, all the leaders of the Israelite tribes and families, so they could witness the transferal of the ark of the Lord’s covenant from the City of David (that is, Zion).

<st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> the <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="06950" class="">assembled</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">before</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> during the <st data-num="02282" class="">festival</st><n id="1" /> in the <st data-num="03391" class="">month</st> of <st data-num="0388" class="">Ethanim</st><n id="2" /> (the <st data-num="01931 07637">seventh</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st>).

When <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel’s</st> <st data-num="02205" class="">elders</st> had <st data-num="0935" class="">arrived</st>, the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st> <st data-num="05375" class="">lifted</st> the <st data-num="0727" class="">ark</st>.
The priests and Levites carried the ark of the Lord, the tent of meeting, and all the holy items in the tent.
Now King Solomon and all the Israelites who had assembled with him went on ahead of the ark and sacrificed more sheep and cattle than could be counted or numbered.
The priests brought the ark of the Lord’s covenant to its assigned place in the inner sanctuary of the temple, in the Most Holy Place, under the wings of the cherubim.

The <st data-num="03588 03742">cherubim’s</st> <st data-num="03671" class="">wings</st> <st data-num="06566" class="">extended</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">over</st> the <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st> where the <st data-num="0727" class="">ark</st> sat; the <st data-num="03742" class="">cherubim</st> <st data-num="05526 05921 04605">overshadowed</st> the <st data-num="0727" class="">ark</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">and</st> its <st data-num="0905" class="">poles</st>.<n id="1" />

The <st data-num="0905" class="">poles</st> <st data-num="0748" class="">were</st> so <st data-num="0748" class="">long</st> <st data-num="0905" class="">their</st> <st data-num="07218" class="">ends</st> were <st data-num="07200" class="">visible</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="06944" class="">Holy Place</st> <st data-num="05921 06440">in front of</st> the <st data-num="01687" class="">inner sanctuary</st>, but they could <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="07200" class="">seen</st> <st data-num="02351" class="">from beyond that point</st>.<n id="1" /> They have <st data-num="01961" class="">remained</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> very <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>.

There was nothing in the ark except the two stone tablets Moses had placed there in Horeb. It was there that the Lord made a covenant with the Israelites after he brought them out of the land of Egypt.
Once the priests left the Holy Place, a cloud filled the Lord’s temple.
The priests could not carry out their duties because of the cloud; the Lord’s glory filled his temple.
Then Solomon said, “The Lord has said that he lives in thick darkness.
O Lord, truly I have built a lofty temple for you, a place where you can live permanently.”

Then the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="05437" class="">turned</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">around</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="01288">pronounced a blessing over</st> the <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israelite</st> <st data-num="06951" class="">assembly</st> as <st data-num="03605 06951 03478">they</st> <st data-num="05975" class="">stood</st> there.<n id="2" />
He said, “The Lord God of Israel is worthy of praise because he has fulfilled what he promised my father David.

He <st data-num="0559" class="">told</st> David,<n id="1" /> ‘<st data-num="04480" class="">Since</st> the <st data-num="03117 0834">day</st> I <st data-num="03318" class="">brought</st> my <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">out</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>, I have <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0977" class="">chosen</st> a <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> from <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="07626" class="">tribes</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> to <st data-num="01129" class="">build</st> a <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> in <st data-num="08033" class="">which</st> to <st data-num="01961 08034">live</st>.<n id="2" /> But I have <st data-num="0977" class="">chosen</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> to <st data-num="01961 05921">lead</st> my <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel.’</st>
Now my father David had a strong desire to build a temple to honor the Lord God of Israel.
The Lord told my father David, ‘It is right for you to have a strong desire to build a temple to honor me.

<st data-num="07535" class="">But</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="01129" class="">build</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>; your <st data-num="03318 02504">very own</st> <st data-num="03588 0518 01121">son</st> will <st data-num="01931 01129">build</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> for my <st data-num="08034" class="">honor</st>.’<n id="1" />

The Lord has kept the promise he made. I have taken my father David’s place and have occupied the throne of Israel, as the Lord promised. I have built this temple for the honor of the Lord God of Israel
and set up in it a place for the ark containing the covenant the Lord made with our ancestors when he brought them out of the land of Egypt.”
Solomon stood before the altar of the Lord in front of the entire assembly of Israel and spread out his hands toward the sky.
He prayed: “O Lord, God of Israel, there is no god like you in heaven above or on earth below! You maintain covenantal loyalty to your servants who obey you with sincerity.

You have <st data-num="0834 08104">kept</st> your <st data-num="0834 01696">word</st> to your <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st>, my <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>;<n id="1" /> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> very <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> you have <st data-num="03027 04390">fulfilled</st> what you <st data-num="01696 06310">promised</st>.<n id="2" />

Now, O Lord, God of Israel, keep the promise you made to your servant, my father David, when you said, ‘You will never fail to have a successor ruling before me on the throne of Israel, provided that your descendants watch their step and serve me as you have done.’
Now, O God of Israel, may the promise you made to your servant, my father David, be realized.
“God does not really live on the earth! Look, if the sky and the highest heaven cannot contain you, how much less this temple I have built!
But respond favorably to your servant’s prayer and his request for help, O Lord my God. Answer the desperate prayer your servant is presenting to you today.

<st data-num="03915" class="">Night</st> and <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> may <st data-num="05869" class="">you</st> <st data-num="01961 06605">watch</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">over</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>, the <st data-num="0413 04725">place</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">where</st> you <st data-num="0559" class="">promised</st> <st data-num="08034" class="">you</st> would <st data-num="01961 08033">live</st>.<n id="1" /> May you <st data-num="08085 0413">answer</st> your <st data-num="0834 06419 05650">servant’s</st> <st data-num="08605" class="">prayer</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">for</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st>.<n id="2" />
Respond to the request of your servant and your people Israel for this place. Hear from inside your heavenly dwelling place and respond favorably.

“When someone is accused of sinning against his neighbor and the latter pronounces a curse on the alleged offender before your altar in this temple, be willing to forgive the accused if the accusation is false.
Listen from heaven and make a just decision about your servants’ claims. Condemn the guilty party, declare the other innocent, and give both of them what they deserve.
“The time will come when your people Israel are defeated by an enemy because they sinned against you. If they come back to you, renew their allegiance to you, and pray for your help in this temple,
then listen from heaven, forgive the sin of your people Israel, and bring them back to the land you gave to their ancestors.

“The time will come when the skies are shut up tightly and no rain falls because your people sinned against you. When they direct their prayers toward this place, renew their allegiance to you, and turn away from their sin because you punish them,

then listen from heaven and forgive the sin of your servants, your people Israel. Certainly you will then teach them the right way to live and send rain on your land that you have given your people to possess.

“The time will come when the land suffers from a famine, a plague, blight and disease, or a locust invasion, or when their enemy lays siege to the cities of the land, or when some other type of plague or epidemic occurs.

<st data-num="0834 01961">When</st> <st data-num="03605 0120 03605">all</st> your <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="03605 08605">pray</st> and <st data-num="03605 08467">ask for help</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> they <st data-num="03045" class="">acknowledge</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">their</st> <st data-num="05061 03824">pain</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="06566" class="">spread out</st> their <st data-num="03709" class="">hands</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">toward</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>,

then <st data-num="0859 08085">listen</st> from your <st data-num="08064" class="">heavenly</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">dwelling</st> <st data-num="04349" class="">place</st>, <st data-num="05545" class="">forgive</st> their sin,<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="06213" class="">act</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">favorably</st> toward <st data-num="0376 03605 01870">each one</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">based on</st> your <st data-num="03045" class="">evaluation</st> of his <st data-num="03824" class="">motives</st>.<n id="2" /> (<st data-num="03588" class="">Indeed</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> are <st data-num="0905" class="">the only one</st> who can <st data-num="03045" class="">correctly evaluate</st> the <st data-num="03824" class="">motives</st> of <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="01121 0120">people</st>.)<n id="3" />
Then they will obey you throughout their lifetimes as they live on the land you gave to our ancestors.
“Foreigners, who do not belong to your people Israel, will come from a distant land because of your reputation.

<st data-num="03588" class="">When</st> they <st data-num="08085" class="">hear about</st> your <st data-num="01419" class="">great</st> <st data-num="08034" class="">reputation</st><n id="1" /> and your <st data-num="03027 02389">ability</st> to <st data-num="02220 05186">accomplish mighty deeds,</st><n id="2" /> they will <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> and <st data-num="06419" class="">direct</st> their <st data-num="06419" class="">prayers</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">toward</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>.

Then listen from your heavenly dwelling place and answer all the prayers of the foreigners. Then all the nations of the earth will acknowledge your reputation, obey you as your people Israel do, and recognize that this temple I built belongs to you.
“When you direct your people to march out and fight their enemies, and they direct their prayers to the Lord toward his chosen city and this temple I built for your honor,
then listen from heaven to their prayers for help and vindicate them.

“The time will come when your people will sin against you (for there is no one who is sinless!) and you will be angry with them and deliver them over to their enemies, who will take them as prisoners to their own land, whether far away or close by.

When your people<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07725" class="">come</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> their <st data-num="03820" class="">senses</st><n id="2" /> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> <st data-num="0834 08033">where</st> they are <st data-num="07617" class="">held prisoner</st>, they will <st data-num="07725" class="">repent</st> and <st data-num="02603 0413">beg for</st> your <st data-num="02603 0413">mercy</st> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of their <st data-num="07617" class="">imprisonment</st>, <st data-num="0559" class="">admitting</st>, ‘We have <st data-num="02398" class="">sinned</st> and <st data-num="05753" class="">gone astray</st>;<n id="3" /> we have <st data-num="07561" class="">done evil</st>.’

When they <st data-num="07725" class="">return</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> you with <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> their <st data-num="03824" class="">heart</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">and</st> <st data-num="05315" class="">being</st><n id="1" /> in the <st data-num="0776 0341">land</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">where</st> they are <st data-num="07617" class="">held prisoner</st>, and <st data-num="06419" class="">direct</st> their <st data-num="06419" class="">prayers</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> you <st data-num="01870" class="">toward</st> the <st data-num="0776 0834">land</st> you <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> to their <st data-num="01" class="">ancestors</st>, your <st data-num="0834 0977">chosen</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st>, and the <st data-num="01004 0834">temple</st> I <st data-num="01129" class="">built</st> for your <st data-num="08034" class="">honor</st>,<n id="3" />

then <st data-num="08085" class="">listen</st> from your <st data-num="08064" class="">heavenly</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">dwelling</st> <st data-num="04349" class="">place</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">to</st> their <st data-num="08605" class="">prayers</st> <st data-num="08467" class="">for help</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="06213 04941">vindicate</st> them.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="05545" class="">Forgive</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="06588 0834 06586">rebellious acts</st> of your <st data-num="0834 02398">sinful</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> and <st data-num="05414 07356 06440">cause</st> their <st data-num="07617" class="">captors</st> to <st data-num="07355" class="">have mercy</st> on them.<n id="1" />
After all, they are your people and your special possession whom you brought out of Egypt, from the middle of the iron-smelting furnace.
“May you be attentive to your servant’s and your people Israel’s requests for help and may you respond to all their prayers to you.

After all, you picked them out of all the nations of the earth to be your special possession, just as you, O Sovereign Lord, announced through your servant Moses when you brought our ancestors out of Egypt.”
When Solomon finished presenting all these prayers and requests to the Lord, he got up from before the altar of the Lord where he had kneeled and spread out his hands toward the sky.

When he <st data-num="05975" class="">stood up</st>, he <st data-num="01288" class="">pronounced a blessing over</st> the <st data-num="03605" class="">entire</st> <st data-num="06951" class="">assembly</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, <st data-num="0559" class="">saying</st> in a <st data-num="01419" class="">loud</st> <st data-num="06963" class="">voice</st>:
“The Lord is worthy of praise because he has made Israel his people secure just as he promised! Not one of all the faithful promises he made through his servant Moses is left unfulfilled!
May the Lord our God be with us, as he was with our ancestors. May he not abandon us or leave us.

May he <st data-num="05186 0413">make</st> <st data-num="03824" class="">us</st> <st data-num="05186 0413">submissive</st>,<n id="1" /> so we can <st data-num="01980" class="">follow</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> his <st data-num="01870" class="">instructions</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="08104" class="">obey</st><n id="3" /> the <st data-num="04687" class="">commandments</st>, <st data-num="02706" class="">rules</st>, and <st data-num="04941" class="">regulations</st> he <st data-num="0834 06680">commanded</st> our <st data-num="01" class="">ancestors</st>.
May the Lord our God be constantly aware of these requests of mine I have presented to him, so that he might vindicate his servant and his people Israel as the need arises.
Then all the nations of the earth will recognize that the Lord is the only genuine God.
May you demonstrate wholehearted devotion to the Lord our God by following his rules and obeying his commandments, as you are now doing.”
The king and all Israel with him were presenting sacrifices to the Lord.
Solomon offered as peace offerings to the Lord 22,000 cattle and 120,000 sheep. Then the king and all the Israelites dedicated the Lord’s temple.

That day the king consecrated the middle of the courtyard that is in front of the Lord’s temple. He offered there burnt sacrifices, grain offerings, and the fat from the peace offerings, because the bronze altar that stood before the Lord was too small to hold all these offerings.

At that time Solomon and all Israel with him celebrated a festival before the Lord our God for two entire weeks. This great assembly included people from all over the land, from Lebo Hamath in the north to the Stream of Egypt in the south.

On the fifteenth day after the festival started, he dismissed the people. They asked God to empower the king and then went to their homes, happy and content because of all the good the Lord had done for his servant David and his people Israel.
